description.environmentInfo: Native to Honduras and Mexico (temperate regions)
description.sunlightInfo: Part sun and part shade, but they like bright light
description.wateringInfo: Every three weeks (or once soil has dried up)
description.repottingInfo: Once the plant has completely filled up the pot (should generally avoid repotting unless necessary)

description.environmentInfo: Native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa (relatively dry)
description.sunlightInfo: Part sun and part shade, but they prefer bright, indirect light
description.wateringInfo: About once a week (or once soil has dried up)
description.repottingInfo: Repot when the roots are big enough
description.pottingInfo: Just slightly larger than the plant's root

description.environmentInfo: Native to Asia but has been found growing in many parts of the world (warm climates)
description.soilInfo: Well-drained soils (e.g. sandy loam, loam, and clay loams)
description.sunlightInfo: Full sun (at least six hours of direct sunlight on most days)
description.wateringInfo: About 1 inch of water per week (soil should be slightly moist)
description.repottingInfo: Can replant about every month for a continual harvest
description.pottingInfo: Shallow pot that is no more than 6-8 inches deep

description.environmentInfo: Native to the tropical rainforests of South America (humid climates)
description.soilInfo: Prefers a soil that can mix drainage and moisture retention (e.g. perlite, peat moss, coir, or loam)
description.wateringInfo: Water once or twice per week (soil should be slightly moist)
description.repottingInfo: Every year or two (or when suffering from root rot and requires root pruning)
description.pottingInfo: Just slightly larger than the plant's root
